name: Powerhouse Nasir v2.1
description:
v2.1: Retooled the icebreaker suite to free up influence from Morning Star. MS is out and 2 Rooks are now in to get Nasir more of that sweet, sweet in-run money. And they're also in because I've noticed as more and more people get used to corping against Nasir, you have to play much more of an economic denial game with him - it's not enough to keep your credits on par with what they're losing. You need to be beating them down because there's a growing trend that poses a HUGE problem for Nasir: want to keep him out of a scoring server? No worries - just make sure to get ice 4 or 5 deep before even putting a single agenda down. Protect a Melange or a Pad or a Sundew, even a Jackson behind one or two ice, something the runner probably figures might not be worth the trash run + cost, and then add another piece of ice. And then another. Heck, cap it all off by putting a Pop Up or Ice Wall on the outside, and Nasir can't touch that server for days. So what the heck, I've made room for a few Cyberfeeders to see what they can't do for me mid-run. These tweaks are as of yet untested.

After a lot of conversation and some good back-and-forth, I've come to realize that Nasir might actually be one of the best big rig runners in the game. So I've built this deck around the old big-rig adage: "Efficient breakers, and the rest of your deck for money." Corps dread that beefy Shaper econ, and have to build up to make sure they can deal with it by the mid-game, by the time it's usually kicking in. But Nasir's ability, when played with proper Workshop or SMC use, turns economy, rig-building, and runs into the same thing - the main thing the corp usually does to slow you down (rezzing ice) is now the one thing that makes your early game so strong.

This decks has econ in the form 2x Magnum Opus, and econ/draw from 3x Professional Contacts. These will get you flush with cash to dump into a Personal Workshop during your runs, or to pop an SMC and get your big breakers out before your credit pool resets - and that's if the corp chooses to rez in the first place. If you have either your Workshop or an SMC on the table, and start a run with a lot of money, the corp player is forced into a position where they know you can deal with whatever ice they rez, and then have to decide whether it's even worth it to give you the money.

New in v2.0, I've retooled the breaker suite and have dropped Torch for a Gordian Blade. I've also freed up space for 3x Atmans by dropping a Clone Chip, an RDI and a Test Run. I found myself overdrawing into these cards more often than not, which might not seem like a bad thing, but recurring with Clone Chip isn't as important as I thought it would be. Plus you only need two RDI's online before each run becomes a Maker's Eye. And running Atman with a rich Nasir should get you into plenty of servers.

Indexing is also down to only one copy. I find myself always wanting to hold them for the perfect situations, and those don't come up terribly often once you get out of the early game. The last thing I need is an extra card clogging up my hand, or my deck.

Imp stays in as a one-off to help you get rid of any assets should hit a SanSan you can't afford to trash or an NAPD you don't have the money to score (then money up, and snatch it from archives). The deck also runs 3x Scavenges to give Imp extra staying power. You can also use it to retool strength on Atman or reposition your Femme token.

I've also one-offed a Crescentus to add another layer of pressure on the corp. It's the Nasir equivalent of Vamp, only more powerful, and acts as a great SMC-able way to kick the corp when they're down.

name: HB Control
Trick！
For science. You monster.
description:
Love kills slowly.

  • Only Ice up HQ and R&D, play all Agendas and Assets as they come.
  • Advice: Keep some cash. Don't get siphoned too often, but recovering by Gila Hands or Profiteering (take all creds, f#% Bad Pub) is easy.
  • Trash a scored False Lead when the runner is low on cards and you see the opportunity to kill by Neural EMP/Ronin next turn.

Ratio: 8 (8 Flatline, 0 Agendas) : 2 (0/1 An, 1/4 Sh, 1/5 Cr)

name: Testing deck for tourney
description:
I am goign to a tournament in my area and seems to be a decent build for nbn that i like but please comment on it and help out.

Currently only have all the cards up to and including Creation and Control

name: The Dog Whisperer
Rincewind test
description: Basic idea is run constantly and never let death catch me. Any suggestions are welcome!

name: ICE ICE Baby
Anti nasir
description: Not a serious deck

name: HB: End The Fun
My First Anarch - Core only
My first HB deck - core only
Run till death
description: The main goal of this deck is kill rinner with Scorced Earth or Dedicated Response Team. Old and proved flatline with some new cards and ID.

name: Effciency Report
Spacing Guild (Spice Melange)
description:
This is my favorite deck that I have made to date. It plays the way I think when it comes to corp. Slow, methodical and with inevitable purpose.

It current has a 70 percent ratio in about 30 games. Melange and eve campaign are the mvps of this deck. lots of taxing ice. lots of money.

it usually loses one agenda early but once you get set up you have game state control.

name: Noise Personal Workshop
Nevermind
description:
Overmind seemed a good fit with Nasir, since you won't need credits to break subs, and the vast majority of rezzed ice will cost more than it's strength. Play and recycle them.

Pump-able breakers and Magnum Opus for mid-late game Econ.

Demo-runs and multi-access on both R&D and HQ to help against Fast Advance decks. Still playing around with Demo Run vs. Imp. I also think Inside Job could help Nasir out, but haven't found the INF room yet.

name: All fast advance, all the time
description:
Curious to see how many methods of fast advance I could squeeze into a deck, and to test out the new Domestic Sleepers agenda, I put together this Custom Biotics deck.

There is a lot of subtle synergy in the cards here. Mostly the focal point is efficiency committee.

Using EffComm counters, you can bolster your econ and force a run by installing and using Melange Mining corp (even with archived memories). You can use Shipment From SanSan to score agendas using EffComm counters in a non-standard fast advance, which costs way less money. You can also add points to previously scored Domestic Sleepers counters. With 1 scored EffComm, you can activate 2 domestic sleepers in 1 turn!

Domestic sleepers can be your scored 1 point agenda if you don't need to rez archer to stop the runner from scoring your installed EffComms. Or you can use it to turn on archer and slap the runner right in the face with some rig de-development ;)

Vitruvious works in its usual fashion to reinstall sansans, melanges, recover biotics, reinstall trashed ice, or recur shipment from sansans as needed for fast advancing/free normal advancing. Or a blank 3/2 for biotic/SanSan

ABT has usual tricks with Jhow and of course fast advancing as a blank 3/2.

NAPD rounds out the needed points while being its usual pain in the ass self.

Improvements? I'd like to find room for Gila hands to keep the cash flowing, but due to SfSS this deck can run pretty lean. I'd also like to consider using midseasons/psycho instead of SSCG (since it works with Domestic Sleepers), but we'd lose archer, that might be a whole other deck. It is a little ice light, I'd like to see 2 more. Corporate troubleshooter also plays hell with archer, using EffComm to install both melange and CT, then use melange could be a pretty savage turn.

I've won a few games with it and I thought I'd publish it to get some feedback, see if anyone else has gone down this road and had some tips to improve it, and just let others try it out.

name: The Key
description: this deck try to lock R&D, no ice with parasite and keyhole.

name: Power Transmission v1.1
description: Trace heavy deck, get Midway station behind a hive or muckraker to make the runner spend a ton of credits to break into a server. Dropping a Primary Dish behind a data hound is fun, make them suffer for trying to trash it. Invade their hand and dump all their events as soon as you get a Dish out and you see them build credits for a turn passively (like MO click for 8 with a hand of 5 cards). Hive's make it easy to score out an early Astro. Veterans to clear out any Muckracker debts, but could also just be Breaking News and run with it. Once there is more bad-pub generating cards you want, specifically some money or economy cards that give you bad pub, cards like Broadcast Square will become suddenly really great in a build like this. The upcoming Ice in Spaces Between for NBN will also work really well in here with a mid-season side-strategy..?

name: Upstocked Knowledge Keeper
description: Leveraging the Leprechaun to make a Professor build. Has the keeper's time come of age yet? Questionable deck size, could thin further but requires some testing first. Oracle for the high-density of programs.

name: Eureka!
description: probably an idea that's been done before. aiming to set the oracle/motivation combo early and get as much freebies as possible.

name: Nasir with good cards
description: get value off nasir, only without running gimmicks

name: Iain Stirling
description: Cobbled together from a couple of decks I found online and used the only sets I have. This is my first runner deck.

name: HBN
description: I found a few decks online and put them together to make this one. I only have a few sets so the ones listed are currently the only ones I have to work with.

name: Kit Kat v2.3
The Gates Of Hell
description: A hellish fun deck using only code gates. Encrypted Portals and Unorthodox Predictions for the winning. Will-o'-the-Wisp all code gate breakers for the win. Reclamation and Jackson for more Will shenanigans.

name: Runner Cube with upstalk (based off of stimhack)
description: Starting Runner Cards: 2 x Armitage Codebusting 1x Force of Nature 1x Pipeline 1x Aurora

name: Nasir Recuring Free Money (upstalk) 2.0
description:
So after playing abit with Nasir i figured 2 things 1. I had way too much recurring creds 2. Ice destruction seems like the way to go as this forces more Resin of ice from the corp.

I droped the compromised employees as they weren't really pulling their wight (especially if you somehow don't hit the workshop) and spinal modem don't actually hit you that often to warren it.

I also dropped the sure gambles as i found alot of the time they were useless (which was an odd feeling to be sure).

Battering ram and Gordian i've kept the abilty to dump your cash into a breaker before losing all your cash is certainly helpful and allows you to actually make some cash on ice res.

Kraken's gone in cos corps don't like resing ice against nasir so your bound to get an agenda early and it can be a nasty surprise. i dont know how much use this will actually be but its more destruction so heres hoping.

name: Corp Grid Draft with Upstalk (based off of stimhack)
description:
REMOVE EXECUTIVE RETREAT & PROJECT WOTAN & RESTRUCTURED DATAPOOL BEFORE DRAFTING.

Starting Corp Cards: 5 x Priority Requisition 2 x Private Contracts

name: Your Near-Earth Grave
description: Build your remote empire, get the runner tagged, and whittle them down or flatline them with Psychic Field + DRT
